Topic.Title: MSFT stealing search market, Google stealing display ad, what else is left for Yahoo?

Message.Msg: Big difference actually. When Microsoft partnered with Yahoo, search users started abandoning Yahoo and going to Bing which took search share away from Yahoo. With this Google deal, users aren't going to go to Google because Google doesn't have the top content properties that Yahoo does (where the Google ads will show up). If Google had huge properties like News, Sports, Finance, and Entertainment they wouldn't be doing this partnership Yahoo because they'd just run AdSense ads across their own huge network of top sites. But they don't. This is why the Yahoo property traffic is SO important. So Google grows it's AdSense reach via Yahoo's largest properties in the world and Yahoo gets paid for every user click on a Google AdSense ad across those Yahoo properties. Really, Google is just another contextual partner of Yahoo's. They just happen to be better than all of Yahoo's other contextual partners because Google can bring more relavant ads to the table (due to its monster search database which it uses to drive the Adsense ads). That means, more clicks on Yahoo and more engagement on Yahoo. This is a win/win for both companies because they both need each other to make this work in the end. They should have done this a long time ago.

Topic.Title: Alibaba Group Hired Credit Suisse, Goldman for IPO

Message.Msg: They are putting the finishing touches on Alibaba's IPO.

Topic.Title: Alibaba to meet with advisors about IPO plans

Message.Msg: Alibaba Group, whose shareholders include Yahoo [YHOO:US] and Japan’s Softbank [9984:JP], has been working on an internal restructuring in preparation for a future listing, this news service reported in early December. An investment invitation document circulated among private equity funds at that time suggested Alibaba would list at the group level in the second half of 2013 seeking a valuation of USD 59.55bn, according to the report. $60 Billion!!!

Message.Title: Alibaba to meet with advisors about IPO plans, FT reports
Message.Msg: Alibaba Group, which Yahoo (YHOO) owns a minority stake in, will meet advisors about plans for an IPO shortly after Chinese New Year, according to the Financial Times, citing three industry sources. Two sources believe Hong Kong will be the listing platform, while the third source said New York could be a possibility.

Topic.Title: Alibaba to meet with advisors about IPO plans, FT reports

Message.Msg: The Hangzhou-based company has not yet hired anyone to arrange the deal, but it has been reaching out to investment banks and law firms about meeting shortly after the holidays, two of the sources said. Chinese New Year runs from 10 February to 15 February in mainland China.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Best Way To Participate In The Alibaba IPO

Message.Msg: Yahoo is sitting golden going into the IPO. My hope is that they hold onto the final 10% of Alibaba and take a nice post IPO ride up. The two strong elements of the deal for Yhoo are the equity that they will gain as part of the IPO cash out of half of their remaining holdings (not counting the interest in Alibaba that they have through Yahoo Japan) and the clarity of share value that Alibaba will project for the remainder of their holdings after the IPO. IMO Yahoo Japan will want to close out their purchase of Yahoo's interest in them prior to the IPO so that they can reserve a good chunk of the Alibaba IPO gain for themselves. If the Alibaba IPO goes first, then the Yahoo Japan deal may wait until the value of Alibaba is better defined in a post IPO environment (perhaps 6-10 mo following the IPO. All of this is simply my view based on what I would do if I were doing it (but like everyone else here I am simply speculating based on what I have read).

Topic.Title: Alibaba to meet with advisors about IPO plans, FT reports

Message.Msg: In anticipation of the coming IPO, several foreign and domestic private equity funds recently approached some senior Alibaba Group staff about buying their stock options, a person familiar with the company said. The offers ranged from the equivalent of USD $16 to USD $22 per share, the person said.

Message.Msg: Unlikely, but if goog decided to do it, his chances of passing the anti-trust is good, now that FB displaced YHOO behind goog in display ad ranking. More chance of getting approval is when YHOO sells his search business say to MSFT or FB as a condition of a gov't approval. MM could get a higher position in goog in addition of running YHOO. This is also apply to MSFT buying out YHOO. MM could become the CEO of the combined MSFT and YHOO. These are alll scenarios that could happen.

Topic.Title: Marissa Mayer

Message.Msg: It is a business philosophy that if you cannot beat them, join them. MM knows that goog technology is far far superior than YHOO. It is a win-win partnership but YHOO got more it I think.

Topic.Title: Yahoo please help reduce harassment, allow post creators ability to delete own posts

Message.Msg: There IS NOW almost THREE THOUSAND repost, that's 3 THOUSAND REpost harassing one Yahoo! account holder at the AMD message board!!!! Why? Because he is" trying" to post anything or something about AMD that is NOT negative, while they "team up" on him with their disgusting immature way of treating posters this way-like trash. I mean, what is the point? I'm still trying to figure it out, is what a financial message board is for? Nothing but a forum for hate and bashing??? That IS THREE thousand repost in ((SEVEN)) days! This is absolutely appalling in the full sense of the meaning what (abuse) is. To me, it's actually beyond belief it has even gone this far!!!!! Is there anyone out there? Can you hear me Yahoo! ????
